original_data.Title: Managing Network Security
original_data.Short Intro: Almost every organization uses computer networks to share their information and to support their business operations. When we allow network access to data  it is exposed to threats from inside and outside of the organization.  This course examines the threats associated with using internal and external networks and how to manage the protection of information when it’s accessible via networks.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish
original_data.Instructors: Herbert J. Mattord, Ph.D., CISM, CISSP, CDP

unified_data.title: Managing Network Security
unified_data.description: Almost every organization uses computer networks to share their information and to support their business operations. When we allow network access to data  it is exposed to threats from inside and outside of the organization.  This course examines the threats associated with using internal and external networks and how to manage the protection of information when it’s accessible via networks.
unified_data.prerequisites: Basic computer literacy and familiarity with networking concepts is recommended. No prior cybersecurity experience is required.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Understand network security threats, and how to protect information accessed via networks. Learn about intrusion detection, firewalls, and wireless security to manage and mitigate risks.
unified_data.price: Free to audit, paid certificate available

original_data.Title: Algorithms on Graphs
original_data.Short Intro: If you have ever used a navigation service to find optimal route and estimate time to destination, you've used algorithms on graphs. Graphs arise in various real-world situations as there are road networks, computer networks and, most recently, social networks! If you're looking for the fastest time to get to work, cheapest way to connect a set of computers into a network or efficient algorithm to automatically find communities and opinion leaders in Facebook, you're going to work with graphs and algorithms on graphs.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.title: Algorithms on Graphs
unified_data.description: If you have ever used a navigation service to find optimal route and estimate time to destination, you've used algorithms on graphs. Graphs arise in various real-world situations as there are road networks, computer networks and, most recently, social networks! If you're looking for the fastest time to get to work, cheapest way to connect a set of computers into a network or efficient algorithm to automatically find communities and opinion leaders in Facebook, you're going to work with graphs and algorithms on graphs.
unified_data.prerequisites: Basic programming knowledge and familiarity with data structures.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Understand and apply graph algorithms for real-world problems like finding optimal routes and network optimization. Learn to identify communities and opinion leaders in social networks using efficient algorithms.

original_data.Title: CCNA: Computer Networking Essentials
original_data.Short Intro: Acquire the skills needed to become a Cisco Certified Network Associate and launch your career in computer networks.

original_data.Course Short Intro: Acquire the skills needed to become a Cisco Certified Network Associate and launch your career in computer networks.

unified_data.title: CCNA: Computer Networking Essentials
unified_data.description: Acquire the skills needed to become a Cisco Certified Network Associate and launch your career in computer networks.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: This course will equip you with fundamental networking skills, preparing you for the Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) certification and a career in computer networks.

original_data.Title: Ethical Hacker
original_data.Short Intro: Meet the growing demand for cybersecurity professionals by gaining the offensive security skills to protect an organization’s computer networks and systems.
original_data.Prequisites: Linux, Networking, Programming and Windows OS.
original_data.What you learn: You’ll master the skills necessary to become a successful Ethical Hacker. Learn how to find and exploit vulnerabilities and weaknesses in various systems, design and execute a penetration testing plan, and report on test findings using valid evidence.

unified_data.title: Ethical Hacker
unified_data.description: Meet the growing demand for cybersecurity professionals by gaining the offensive security skills to protect an organization’s computer networks and systems.
prerequisites: Linux, Networking, Programming and Windows OS
learning_outcomes: You’ll master the skills necessary to become a successful Ethical Hacker
Learn how to find and exploit vulnerabilities and weaknesses in various systems, design and execute a penetration testing plan, and report on test findings using valid evidence

original_data.Title: Security Engineer
original_data.Short Intro: Gain the highly sought-after skills to protect an organization’s computer networks and systems from security threats or attacks.
original_data.Prequisites: Basics of Python, experience configuring Windows and Linux environments.
original_data.What you learn: You’ll master the foundational skills necessary to become a successful Security Engineer. This program will focus on how to protect a company’s computer systems, networks, applications and infrastructure from security threats or attacks.

unified_data.title: Security Engineer
unified_data.description: Gain the highly sought-after skills to protect an organization’s computer networks and systems from security threats or attacks.
prerequisites: Basics of Python, experience configuring Windows and Linux environments
learning_outcomes: You’ll master the foundational skills necessary to become a successful Security Engineer
This program will focus on how to protect a company’s computer systems, networks, applications and infrastructure from security threats or attacks

original_data.Title: Security Analyst
original_data.Short Intro: Meet the growing demand for cybersecurity professionals by gaining the skills to protect an organization’s computer networks and systems.
original_data.Prequisites: Experience with Python, SQL, security fundamentals, database design, and networking and operating systems.
original_data.What you learn: You’ll master the skills necessary to become a successful Security Analyst. Learn to identify, correct and respond to security weaknesses and incidents. Plus, get hands-on experience monitoring network traffic, analyzing alert and log data, and following incident handling procedures.
